questions.question_text: After the review of a risk record, internal audit questioned why the risk was lowered from medium to low. Which of the following is the BEST course of action in responding to this inquiry?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agree it is C.

choices.D: An increase in the level of residual risk
choices.C: A decrease in control layering effectiveness

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. An increase in control vulnerabilities
When uncontrolled changes are made to the control environment, the greatest concern is the potential increase in control vulnerabilities. Uncontrolled changes can introduce new weaknesses, gaps, or flaws in the control structure that may be exploited by threat actors. This can lead to a higher likelihood of control failures and security breaches.

While options B (an increase in inherent risk), C (a decrease in control layering effectiveness), and D (an increase in the level of residual risk) are also relevant considerations, control vulnerabilities are typically the most immediate and significant concern when changes to the control environment are not properly managed or controlled.

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be D. Your inherent risk stays the same unless you start new business activities. It is the risk that exists without controls. The controls modify the inherent risk to give you residual risk. If there is a control in place, modifications to the control could impact the amount of risk that is being mitigated which would result in a change in residual risk.

questions.question_text: Which of the following key risk indicators (KRIs) is MOST effective for monitoring risk related to a bring your own device (BYOD) program?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Build a risk profile for management review.

The primary benefit of maintaining an up-to-date risk register is to build a risk profile for management review. A risk register is a tool that helps an organization document and track its identified risks, including their likelihood, impact, and mitigating controls. By maintaining an up-to-date risk register, an organization can have a comprehensive view of its risk landscape, which is essential for informed decision-making and risk management. It helps management understand the nature and extent of risks facing the organization, prioritize risk mitigation efforts, and allocate resources effectively. While uniform controls and risk distribution are important considerations, they are not the primary purpose of a risk register.

Selected Answer: B
Agree it is B.
